result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen L Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

ADDRESS INFO for Karen L Kelley
Current: 2425 Blaine Ave, Racine, WI 53405 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2016)
Prior: 5143 Biscayne Avenue # 107, Racine, WI 53406

Defendant Karen L Kelley in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Move to amend count 1 & count 2 to Disorderly Conduct.
Rights Given
P- NC 
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 & count 2 as amended.

Count 1- CFTC, Waive costs

Count 2- Provide a DNA Sample + pay surchage, Pay a fine of $50 + cc, payment plan of $25 a month to begin on Feburary 15th
ATTY Johnson files motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause.
Per Judge no new bond needed, minutes of 7/28/15 hearing e-mailed to ZCI
Jury trial on January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Karen L Kelley in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - Req adj due to another case proceeding with trial today, also have an officer that is unavailable
Def - No obj, however req bond modified to remove house arrest. She will be moving from her current residence as of July 31 and living temporarily at 5012 Taylor Ave. 

BTC: Adj granted. Bond modified to allow defendant to seek new residence.  Jury trial scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, RL, (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. House arrest with defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). May leave home for medical, attorney and court  appointments. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
2/2/15 - BOND MODIFIED to allow defendant release for appointments/meetings at Womens Resource Center, Legal Action and Housing Authority, and to visit father in the hospital in Illinois once per week as long as she is with her sister.
04/13/15 - BOND MODIFIED: Defendant is not allowed to go to anyone's home, she must be picked up and dropped off at her residence. Defendant may go grocery shopping once per week.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing randomly and after each court appearance.
5/05/15 - BOND AMENDED: Defendant to be on house arrest, allowed release for medical appointments.
6/23/15 - BOND AMENDED: CO-SIGNED BY MATTIE CLAYBROOK AND MARGARET BUTLER. GPS to be removed. House arrest at current residence until notified of move to 5012 Taylor Ave. Apt 3, Racine. Release from home to include Attorney appointments, court, Doctor appointments and one grocery shopping trip per week.

Defendant Karen L Kelley in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerry Solm from ZCI appears by phone means. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.

St -

House arrest at current residence and at 5512 Taylor Ave. Unit 3 when she moves, may leave home for  Court, Attorney visits, Doctor appointments and 1 grocery shopping trip per week. All other cond's remain.
